name: TheAtlantic
text: Nine writers and editors from around our newsroom pick a poem worth revisiting in this moment. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/6Zgeo56DIh

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @amandamull: I wrote about Georgia’s governor, whose disastrous pandemic response and disregard for the state’s residents has made Georgia a microcosm of America under Trump. https://t.co/0HoV8G0JMQ

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "[I]f colleges go ahead, they will endanger the lives of students, staff, faculty, and those who live in the surrounding communities. Reopening colleges is the wrong thing to do." -- @Yascha_Mounk:
https://t.co/B3SUjt44mB

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @IsaacDovere: Rice on her mother warning against the Sunday show round on Benghazi which has haunted her since: 

“Her instinct was, ‘I smell a rat. You shouldn’t do it.’ And I said, ‘Mom, don’t be ridiculous.I’ve done this many times before.’ She was absolutely right.” https://t.co/1MFF67BRGc

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: Even in a country that stands apart from the world for its horrific failures in pandemic respose, one state has emerged as specifically, even singularly, terrible. Georgia. https://t.co/qt6qwGlTbj

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "Some [states] failed to heed early warnings. Others refused to learn the lessons of outbreaks that came before theirs. Still others played politics instead of following science. And then there’s Georgia."
Smart piece from @amandamull, who called it early:
https://t.co/dIJ0qbQ70r

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "Does anybody talk about Dick Cheney’s foul mouth? Or does that in any way define him as the vice president of the United States? I think it’s sexist; that’s what it is." -- @AmbassadorRice to @IsaacDovere:
https://t.co/f8E6oIaq5e

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: “What’s happened since the 1970s and ’80s didn’t just happen. It looks more like arson than a purely accidental fire, more like poisoning than a completely natural illness...” https://t.co/dvSr7mYH6G

name: TheAtlantic
text: Listen to @edyong209 discuss how American healthcare needs to change to beat the coronavirus: https://t.co/WR5xYstVlp

name: TheAtlantic
text:
In the pandemic failures of Georgia Governor Brian Kemp, you can see a microcosm for the country’s trajectory as a whole, writes @amandamull.
https://t.co/lTQLbcJDlx

name: TheAtlantic
text: "There are absolutely many more Americans dead because of Donald Trump's failed leadership," Susan Rice tells @IsaacDovere in the latest episode of "The Ticket." https://t.co/jDE2iTNTgX

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Most college students are at an age when the urge to socialize is especially strong. Whatever the rules may say, young people will have parties, hook up, and leave campus to have fun," @Yascha_Mounk writes: https://t.co/Ee1R0VfOHT

name: TheAtlantic
text: Georgia had an early surge of the virus, and now cases are spiking again. Governor Brian Kemp has refused to learn a thing. @amandamull reports: https://t.co/886KZL8i51

name: TheAtlantic
text: “In our current moment of racial reckoning, Faulkner is certainly ripe for rigorous scrutiny,” writes @DrewFaust28: https://t.co/2ioUIR5LXw

name: TheAtlantic
text: If social distancing regulations fail at colleges, thousands of students—many of them infected with COVID-19—will board trains and planes to go home, spreading the virus to their families, @Yascha_Mounk writes: https://t.co/VSPnMddTO4

name: TheAtlantic
text: The allegations of abuse at Ellen DeGeneres’s talk show have the feeling of a reckoning. But a reckoning about what? @skornhaber on the reality-distortion field of fame: https://t.co/LZ2u2XpQn8

name: TheAtlantic
text: Ferrante’s fiction teems with liars of all ages, from the insecure children of her Neapolitan quartet to the anguished adults of her early novels, @mervatim writes. https://t.co/HWrKx67QbN
